display_long_description:
Start by doing laundry. Stay for the spin cycle — inside the washing machine.

What begins as a strangely satisfying VR chore quickly unravels into a full-blown experiment in dizziness. You load the clothes, press the buttons — and then, without warning, you’re the one tumbling around the drum. This isn’t an accident. The game is designed to trigger motion sickness, and it fully embraces the chaos.

But beyond the swirl of socks and stomach flips, there’s a whole world of absurd distractions. Throw darts with no real goal. Fling tennis balls like a hyperactive golden retriever. Vibe out to 17 original songs — all generated by AI — as your surroundings shift and wobble around you.

And just when you think it couldn’t get weirder, it gets kind of… sweet.

Scattered throughout the game are real stories and pictures of pets shared by players. Some are hilarious, some are touching, all are genuine. You can read them, smile at them, and even add your own pet’s story and photo to the collection.

This is less of a game and more of an experience — equal parts absurd, dizzying, heartfelt, and unforgettable.

Get in. Spin out. Try not to throw up.
